Event.name: Building
Event.definition:
<def-root>This frame describes assembly or construction actions, where an <fen>Agent</fen> joins <fen>Components</fen> together to form a <fen>Created_entity</fen>, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Jack</fex> <t>built</t> <fex name="CrEnt">a new house</fex> <fex name="Cmpnt">out of bricks</fex>.</ex> <ex>We <t>glued</t> the airplanes <fex name="Result">together</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> builds a <fen>Created_entity</fen>. <ex><fex name="Agent">Jack</fex> <t>built</t> a new house.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen>(s) with which an <fen>Agent</fen> builds a <fen>Created_entity</fen>. <ex>Jack built a new house <fex name="Ins">with hammer and nails</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the building occurs.
<ex>Jack <t>built</t> a new house <fex name="Place">in a glade</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which an intentional act is performed. <ex>Jack <t>built</t> a new house <fex name="Purp"> to have more living space</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the building occurs.
<ex>Jack <t>built</t> a new house <fex name="Time">early in the morning</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which an <fen>Agent</fen> builds a <fen>Created_entity</fen>. <ex>Jack <t>built</t> a new house <fex name="Means">by enlisting the help of his friends</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Components
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Components</fen> that form the <fen>Created_entity</fen>. <ex>Jack built a new house <fex name="Cmpnt">out of old bricks</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Created_entity
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Created_entity</fen> identifies the entity that is created in the act of building. <ex>Jack <t>built</t> <fex name="CrEnt">a new house</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Result</fen> of the act of building. <ex>We <t>glued</t> the airplanes <fex name="Result">together</fex>.</ex></def-root >

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> identifes the phrase describing the participant in the act of building. <ex>Jack <t>built</t> the new house <fex name="Depict">naked</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE idenitifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> builds a <fen>Created_entity</fen>.
<ex>Jack <t>built</t> a new house <fex name="Manner">lovingly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Beneficiary
Arg.definition: <def-root>This extrathematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: assemble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fit together the component parts of

lexUnit.name: glue.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: onstruct a whole product by means of gluing piece together.

lexUnit.name: build.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: construct by putting parts or materials together

lexUnit.name: weld.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to combine and form a whole.

lexUnit.name: put together.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: attach constituent parts together to form

lexUnit.name: assembly.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of assembling component parts

lexUnit.name: construction.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action or process of constructing.

lexUnit.name: make.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: form by putting parts together (cf. COD: form by putting parts together or combining substances)

lexUnit.name: fit together.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join or cause to join together to form a whole. no obj.

lexUnit.name: piece together.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: assemble something from individual parts

lexUnit.name: fashion.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make into a particular form or article.

lexUnit.name: construction [entity].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the physical manifestion of the act of construction
